text:
Hi :raising_hand: 
I'm wondering what I'd need to process a large (~1TB) CSV file with Julia.
Is the CSV.File method and a simple loop all I need/have?
If I had a groupby method available I could loop over the groups and use basic math operations on the groups.
Otherwise, I guess I need a loop over every line.
The CSV contains trajectories (i,x,y,t) basically, and I want to calculate a simple conditional addition based on 't(i)-1' and 't(i)'
